FuncDef:
The nat syslog flexible template command creates a NAT flexible log template and displays its view.
The undo nat syslog flexible template command deletes a NAT flexible log template.
By default, no flexible log template is created.
CLIs: nat syslog flexible template { user | session }
undo nat syslog flexible template session
undo nat syslog flexible template { user | session }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates user logs. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow a device to output syslog information in a format mapped to a customer log system, run the nat syslog flexible template command
Configuration Impact
If the centralized board mode is used and no log format is specified in a flexible log template, the default type 3 format takes effect for both user and flow logs. If a log format is specified in a flexible log template for user or flow logs, the user or flow logs are sent in the flexible log template format. If the on-board mode is used and no NAT syslog format is specified in a flexible log template, the default type 3 format takes effect for flow logs. If a log format is specified in a flexible log template, flow logs are sent in the flexible log template format.
Follow-up Procedure
After the NAT flexible log template view is displayed, run the nat position command or nat position command to configure a NAT flexible log format; run the ds-lite position command or ds-lite position command to configure a DS-Lite flexible log format; run the nat64 position command or nat64 position command to configure a NAT64 flexible log format.
